reviews.text: My parents in law stayed here for Easter weekend, they felt it was excellent value for money, spotlessly clean and got a great nights sleep. The hotel has been recently refurbished, with dark woods and tartans. This may not be to everyones personal taste but it has been well done and is really well maintained. We have stayed in a few Best Westerns and had some pretty ropey experiences, this is miles better and a really nice place. We made a point of asking for a quiet, good sized room. It is an older building, as a result a few of the rooms are a bit smaller with velux windows, but our requests were accomodated no problem.
reviews.title: Miles better than other Best Westerns, excellent value, good rooms and food"

reviews.text: The hotel was quieter as there was no wedding function on Saturday and the staff were honest that when a wedding is on there can be more noise in the hotel corriders.

reviews.text: Eaglesham is a beautiful conservation village, and the hotel overlooks the large village green. It's not excatly on Glasgow's doorstep but close enough to the motorway links if you are driving to Glasgow or Ayrshire. If you are a tourist looking for an alternative base out of the city buzz this would be a nice place to stay.
reviews.title: A perfect stay

description: Dating back to 1835, the BEST WESTERN Eglinton Arms Hotel is an old coaching inn, privately owned set at the edge of the village green in the heart of the rural village of Eaglesham. Highly reputated locally and open for meals all day, the split level restaurant is tastefully decorated with feature fireplaces, tartan carpets and stag's heads with a nod to a Scottish country house hotel with a modern contemporary twist. The hotel has 34 en-suite rooms, comprising single, double & twin options as well as a banqueting suite catering for up to 120 for weddings & family events.
